Line 44: Line 44:
== Criticism ==
== Criticism ==
â
The pure freeware model of software development has been criticized as "unsustainable" because it requires a single entity to be responsible for updating and enhancing the product, which is then given away for free. Most successful freeware products have been ad-supported or "freemium" in which the free product serves to promote a commercial offering.[http://www.zdnet.com/blog/saas/free-is-not-a-business-model/807] Other freeware projects are simply released as [[one off]] programs with no promise or expectation of further development. These may include source code so that a user can make any required or desired changes themselves.
+
The pure freeware model of software development has been criticized as "unsustainable" because it requires a single entity to be responsible for updating and enhancing the product, which is then given away for free. Most successful freeware products have been ad-supported or "freemium" in which the free product serves to promote a commercial offering.[http://www.zdnet.com/blog/saas/free-is-not-a-business-model/807] Other freeware projects are simply released as [[one off]] programs with no promise or expectation of further development. These may include [[source code]], in the case of [[open source software]], so that a user can make any required or desired changes themselves.
